properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Resort Village Of Manitou Beach
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Resort Village of Manitou Beach and the Watrous South Rural Water Utility. This advisory is for the entire Resort Village of Manitou Beach and for any individuals who may access the Manitou Beach water system including the Watrous South Rural Water Utility.
Expires: 2019-09-23T13:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK RV of Manitou Beach, 2019-09-17T16:41:57-06:00, 36DA39F1-5579-FBE2-29AC-C3E4BE90BF86
Area: Resort Village of Manitou Beach
properties.Author: SK RV of Manitou Beach

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and large hail. A low pressure system in North Dakota will track northward near the Saskatchewan Manitoba border tonight, bringing thunderstorms through the area. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe due to the very warm, humid, and unstable conditions. Very strong wind gusts are the main threat with these thunderstorms, as well as marginally severe hail. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T13:14:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T02:18:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2027041855.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain and thunderstorms are expected this evening and overnight. Rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm are possible. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T12:41:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-17T20:42:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2976563886.2019
Area: Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Lookout - Eastern Lac Seul, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect

Rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm will be possible by the time the precipitation comes to an end late overnight. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:18 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. At 12:15 am, radar showed a line of strong thunderstorms from Springside northward to Endeavour, then east through areas north of Swan Plain. The area of thunderstorms is tracking northeast at around 40 km/h. Some of these thunderstorms are capable of producing torrential downpours and nickel sized hail. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-18T09:14:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T06:19:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2984062703.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. The temperatures will fall under the freezing mark over these areas overnight tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T17:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T02:20:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1486729662.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:59 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. At 12:55 am CST, 1:55 am CDT, radar showed an area of strong thunderstorms west of Pelly, and a line of severe thunderstorms from Mafeking westward to south of Hudson Bay. All thunderstorms are tracking east to northeast at 40 km/h. The strongest thunderstorms are west of Mafeking and these may be producing large hail. The thunderstorms west of Pelly are likely giving heavy rain and may also be producing nickel sized hail. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-09-18T09:39:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T07:00:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1089775488.2019
Area: R.M. of Hudson Bay including Hudson Bay and Reserve, R.M. of Keys including The Key Res., R.M. of Sliding Hills including Veregin Mikado and Hamton, R.M. of Clayton including Norquay Stenen and Swan Plain, R.M. of Livingston including Arran
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop under the freezing mark over these areas tonight and overnight Wednesday. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T18:20:47-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will allow ground temperatures to cool to near or below zero over many regions of New Brunswick tonight. Similar conditions are likely again Wednesday night. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-18T17:09:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-18T01:35:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4063027443.2019
